elements.content: On the basis of the ligand of 5-(pyridin-3-yl)­isophthalic acid (H2L), a new distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster based metal–organic framework with (3,3,6) topology, [Mn2(L)2DMF]­·DMF·MeOH (NJU-Bai33; DMF = N,N- dimethylformamide), was synthesized, which exhibits a new point (Schläfli) symbol of (4·62)2(42·68·85), contains open metal sites, and shows selective adsorption of CO2 over N2 and CH4 with CO2 uptake amounts high up to 7.9 and 4.2 wt % at 0.15 bar and at 273 and 298 K, respectively.
elements.clean_text: On the basis of the ligand of 5-(pyridin-3-yl)isophthalic acid (H2L), a new distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster based metal-organic framework with (3,3,6) topology, [Mn2(L)2DMF]⋅DMF⋅MeOH (NJU-Bai33; DMF = N,N- dimethylformamide), was synthesized, which exhibits a new point (Schläfli) symbol of (4⋅62)2(42⋅68⋅85), contains open metal sites, and shows selective adsorption of CO2 over N2 and CH4 with CO2 uptake amounts high up to 7.9 and 4.2 wt % at 0.15 bar and at 273 and 298 K, respectively.

elements.content: A new distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster based metal−organic framework with (3,3,6) topology was synthesized, which exhibits a new point (Schläfli) symbol of (4·62)2­(42·68·85), contains open metal sites after removal of the ligated solvent, and shows selective adsorption of CO2 over N2 and CH4 with CO2 uptake amounts high up to 7.9 and 4.2 wt % at 0.15 bar and at 273 and 298 K, respectively.
elements.clean_text: A new distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster based metal-organic framework with (3,3,6) topology was synthesized, which exhibits a new point (Schläfli) symbol of (4⋅62)2(42⋅68⋅85), contains open metal sites after removal of the ligated solvent, and shows selective adsorption of CO2 over N2 and CH4 with CO2 uptake amounts high up to 7.9 and 4.2 wt % at 0.15 bar and at 273 and 298 K, respectively.

elements.content: Global warming is one of our great concerns due to the rapid growth of CO2 emissions. To reduce the anthropogenic CO2 emissions, great efforts have been devoted to the development of diverse CO2 capture materials, and many porous solids have been intensively investigated, such as zeolites and carbons et al. Recently, metal–organic frameworks (MOFs), emerging as a new class of porous materials for CO2 capture and sequestration (CCS), have attracted great attention because of their crystalline nature, fascinating structures, extraordinary surface area, functionalizable pore surface, and tunable pore size and shape.
elements.clean_text:
Introduction

Global warming is one of our great concerns due to the rapid growth of CO2 emissions. To reduce the anthropogenic CO2 emissions, great efforts have been devoted to the development of diverse CO2 capture materials, and many porous solids have been intensively investigated, such as zeolites and carbons et al. Recently, metal-organic frameworks (MOFs), emerging as a new class of porous materials for CO2 capture and sequestration (CCS), have attracted great attention because of their crystalline nature, fascinating structures, extraordinary surface area, functionalizable pore surface, and tunable pore size and shape.

elements.content: One of our research focuses is the construction of novel MOFs with potential applications in CO2 capture from rigid and flexible multidentate ligands which contain both a homodonor and a heterodonor. For example, very recently, based on the organic ligand of 5-(pyridin-3-yl)­isophthalic acid (H2L), a (3,6)-connected MOFs with rtl topology, NJU-Bai7, was designed, in which the inorganic secondary building unit (SBU) of the 6-connected Cu-paddlewheel is one of the most common molecular building blocks. To further enrich our work, the manganese ion (Mn2+) was selected to construct the versatile MOFs because it may lead to the different 6-connected metal clusters in comparison to Cu2+ because of its changeable coordinating number and coordination geometry. Herein, a new distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster based MOF with (3,3,6) topology, NJU-Bai33, is presented, which exhibits a new point (Schläfli) symbol of (4·62)2(42·68·85), contains open metal sites after removal of the ligated solvent, and shows selective adsorption of CO2 over N2 and CH4 with CO2 uptake amounts high up to 7.9 and 4.2 wt % at 0.15 bar and at 273 and 298 K, respectively.
elements.clean_text: One of our research focuses is the construction of novel MOFs with potential applications in CO2 capture from rigid and flexible multidentate ligands which contain both a homodonor and a heterodonor. For example, very recently, based on the organic ligand of 5-(pyridin-3-yl)isophthalic acid (H2L), a (3,6)-connected MOFs with rtl topology, NJU-Bai7, was designed, in which the inorganic secondary building unit (SBU) of the 6-connected Cu-paddlewheel is one of the most common molecular building blocks. To further enrich our work, the manganese ion (Mn2+) was selected to construct the versatile MOFs because it may lead to the different 6-connected metal clusters in comparison to Cu2+ because of its changeable coordinating number and coordination geometry. Herein, a new distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster based MOF with (3,3,6) topology, NJU-Bai33, is presented, which exhibits a new point (Schläfli) symbol of (4⋅62)2(42⋅68⋅85), contains open metal sites after removal of the ligated solvent, and shows selective adsorption of CO2 over N2 and CH4 with CO2 uptake amounts high up to 7.9 and 4.2 wt % at 0.15 bar and at 273 and 298 K, respectively.

elements.content: Solvothermal reaction of MnCl2·4H2O with H2L in N,N- dimethylformamide/methanol containing hydrochloric acid afforded a high yield of colorless block crystals of NJU-Bai33. The single X-ray crystal structure reveals that it crystallizes in monoclinic space group Cc. In the asymmetric unit of NJU-Bai33, there are two crystallographically independent Mn­(II) ions (Mn1 and Mn2), two different kinds of H2L with different coordination modes (L1 and L2), and one coordinated DMF solvent molecule (Figure S1). The Mn1 atom is six-coordinated by five oxygen atoms from four different H2L ligands and one nitrogen atom from another H2L ligand to form a distorted octahedral geometry (a). The Mn2 is also six-coordinated and surrounded by four oxygen atoms from three distinct H2L ligands, one oxygen atom from one DMF molecule, and one nitrogen atom from a different H2L ligand. Thus, different from the Cu-paddlewheel unit of NJU-Bai7, the new binuclear cluster of [Mn2(COO)4N2] with coordinated DMF molecule in NJU-Bai33 is composed of four carboxyl groups, two nitrogen atoms, and one DMF molecule. In the Mn-cluster, four oxygen atoms of two carboxyl groups from two ligands with L1 mode are coordinated to two Mn­(II) ions by adopting bridging and bridging-chelate modes, respectively (b). Two oxygen atoms of one carboxyl group from one ligand with L2 mode are attached to the two Mn­(II) ions by the bridging mode. Two other oxygen atoms of one carboxyl group from another ligand with L2 mode chelates Mn1 atom, and two nitrogen atoms from other two H2L with distinct coordination modes of L1 and L2, are bound to Mn1 and Mn2, respectively. In addition, one oxygen atom from DMF solvent molecule is coordinated to Mn2 atom. It is interesting to note that, as shown in c, the H2L ligand in NJU-Bai33 has two different types of coordination modes, L1 and L2, which are different from the only one coordination mode of H2L ligand in NJU-Bai7. The ligand with L1 mode bridges three Mn-clusters through two carboxyl groups with one adopting the bridging-chelating mode, another using the chelating one, and one N atom. Meanwhile, the ligand with L2 mode links three Mn-clusters through two carboxyl groups with one adopting the bridging mode, another using the chelating one, and one N atom.
elements.clean_text:
Results and Discussion

Solvothermal reaction of MnCl2⋅4H2O with H2L in N,N- dimethylformamide/methanol containing hydrochloric acid afforded a high yield of colorless block crystals of NJU-Bai33. The single X-ray crystal structure reveals that it crystallizes in monoclinic space group Cc. In the asymmetric unit of NJU-Bai33, there are two crystallographically independent Mn(II) ions (Mn1 and Mn2), two different kinds of H2L with different coordination modes (L1 and L2), and one coordinated DMF solvent molecule (Figure S1). The Mn1 atom is six-coordinated by five oxygen atoms from four different H2L ligands and one nitrogen atom from another H2L ligand to form a distorted octahedral geometry (a). The Mn2 is also six-coordinated and surrounded by four oxygen atoms from three distinct H2L ligands, one oxygen atom from one DMF molecule, and one nitrogen atom from a different H2L ligand. Thus, different from the Cu-paddlewheel unit of NJU-Bai7, the new binuclear cluster of [Mn2(COO)4N2] with coordinated DMF molecule in NJU-Bai33 is composed of four carboxyl groups, two nitrogen atoms, and one DMF molecule. In the Mn-cluster, four oxygen atoms of two carboxyl groups from two ligands with L1 mode are coordinated to two Mn(II) ions by adopting bridging and bridging-chelate modes, respectively (b). Two oxygen atoms of one carboxyl group from one ligand with L2 mode are attached to the two Mn(II) ions by the bridging mode. Two other oxygen atoms of one carboxyl group from another ligand with L2 mode chelates Mn1 atom, and two nitrogen atoms from other two H2L with distinct coordination modes of L1 and L2, are bound to Mn1 and Mn2, respectively. In addition, one oxygen atom from DMF solvent molecule is coordinated to Mn2 atom. It is interesting to note that, as shown in c, the H2L ligand in NJU-Bai33 has two different types of coordination modes, L1 and L2, which are different from the only one coordination mode of H2L ligand in NJU-Bai7. The ligand with L1 mode bridges three Mn-clusters through two carboxyl groups with one adopting the bridging-chelating mode, another using the chelating one, and one N atom. Meanwhile, the ligand with L2 mode links three Mn-clusters through two carboxyl groups with one adopting the bridging mode, another using the chelating one, and one N atom.

elements.content: (a) The ball and stick model of the distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster with coordinated DMF molecule. The gray, red, rose, and blue spheres represent carbon, oxygen, manganese, and nitrogen atoms, respectively. (b) The coordination environment of the distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster; (c) the coordination modes of the organic ligand, H2L.
elements.clean_text: 1  (a) The ball and stick model of the distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster with coordinated DMF molecule. The gray, red, rose, and blue spheres represent carbon, oxygen, manganese, and nitrogen atoms, respectively. (b) The coordination environment of the distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster; (c) the coordination modes of the organic ligand, H2L.

elements.content: Compared with the structure of NJU-Bai7 from the paddlewheel unit linked through the isophthalic acid moiety of H2L followed by the pillaring of the pyridyl group, in the structure of NJU-Bai33, the binuclear [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster is connected through the ligand with L2 mode leading to the formation of two-dimensional layers with hcb topology (a and S2), which is further pillared by the ligand with L1 mode giving the formation of 3D porous framework. Along the opposite direction of the c axis, the hcb topological layer adopts the packing way of AB stacking model, in which the layer of B can be turned from the layer of A by a reflection of the ac mirror (Figure S2). Thus, different from the only one type of 1D channel formed in NJU-Bai7, two similar one-dimensional channels along the directions of (a+b) and (a-b) are generated in NJU-Bai33, respectively (b, S3 and 4). With the coordinated DMF molecule removed, both of their pore sizes are about 4.0 × 4.8 Å2 determined by the van der Waals diameter of the inserted pseudoatom, which are larger than that of 3.4 × 3.4 Å2 in NJU-Bai7. From the viewpoint of structural topology, in NJU-Bai33, the binuclear Mn-clusters can be viewed as 6-connected nodes, and organic ligands with two different coordination modes of L1 and L2 can be simplified as two different kinds of 3-connected nodes. Therefore, its overall framework may be simplified as a new (3,3,6)-connected network (a), which is different from the (3,6)-connected topological net in NJU-Bai7. Topological analysis by the TOPOS program suggests that the point (Schläfli) symbol of the network is (4·62)2(42·68·85), which represents a new topology. Moreover, the total potential solvent accessible volumes in desolvated NJU-Bai33 after removal of guest solvates and coordinated DMF molecule is around 33.5% as determined by the PLATON/SOLV program giving a calculated density of 1.109 g cm–3 for the desolvated framework.
elements.clean_text: Compared with the structure of NJU-Bai7 from the paddlewheel unit linked through the isophthalic acid moiety of H2L followed by the pillaring of the pyridyl group, in the structure of NJU-Bai33, the binuclear [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster is connected through the ligand with L2 mode leading to the formation of two-dimensional layers with hcb topology (a and S2), which is further pillared by the ligand with L1 mode giving the formation of 3D porous framework. Along the opposite direction of the c axis, the hcb topological layer adopts the packing way of AB stacking model, in which the layer of B can be turned from the layer of A by a reflection of the ac mirror (Figure S2). Thus, different from the only one type of 1D channel formed in NJU-Bai7, two similar one-dimensional channels along the directions of (a+b) and (a-b) are generated in NJU-Bai33, respectively (b, S3 and 4). With the coordinated DMF molecule removed, both of their pore sizes are about 4.0 × 4.8 Å2 determined by the van der Waals diameter of the inserted pseudoatom, which are larger than that of 3.4 × 3.4 Å2 in NJU-Bai7. From the viewpoint of structural topology, in NJU-Bai33, the binuclear Mn-clusters can be viewed as 6-connected nodes, and organic ligands with two different coordination modes of L1 and L2 can be simplified as two different kinds of 3-connected nodes. Therefore, its overall framework may be simplified as a new (3,3,6)-connected network (a), which is different from the (3,6)-connected topological net in NJU-Bai7. Topological analysis by the TOPOS program suggests that the point (Schläfli) symbol of the network is (4⋅62)2(42⋅68⋅85), which represents a new topology. Moreover, the total potential solvent accessible volumes in desolvated NJU-Bai33 after removal of guest solvates and coordinated DMF molecule is around 33.5% as determined by the PLATON/SOLV program giving a calculated density of 1.109 g cm-3 for the desolvated framework.

elements.content: (a) The metal cluster is linked by the ligand with L2 mode leading to the formation of a 2D hcb topological layer, which is further pillared by the ligand with L1 mode giving the formation of 3D NJU-Bai33 (top and middle); (middle) in NJU-Bai33, the 2D hcb topological layer adopts the packing way of AB stacking model; (bottom) the topological network of NJU-Bai33 with the point symbol of (4·62)2(42·68·85), in which organic ligands with two different coordination modes of L1 (lime) and L2 (gold) can be simplified as two different kinds of 3-connected nodes; (b) in NJU-Bai33, two similar 1D channels along the directions of (a+b) and (a-b) are formed, respectively, and both of their pore sizes are 4.0 × 4.8 Å2. H atom and the coordinated DMF molecule are omitted for clarity.
elements.clean_text: 2  (a) The metal cluster is linked by the ligand with L2 mode leading to the formation of a 2D hcb topological layer, which is further pillared by the ligand with L1 mode giving the formation of 3D NJU-Bai33 (top and middle); (middle) in NJU-Bai33, the 2D hcb topological layer adopts the packing way of AB stacking model; (bottom) the topological network of NJU-Bai33 with the point symbol of (4⋅62)2(42⋅68⋅85), in which organic ligands with two different coordination modes of L1 (lime) and L2 (gold) can be simplified as two different kinds of 3-connected nodes; (b) in NJU-Bai33, two similar 1D channels along the directions of (a+b) and (a-b) are formed, respectively, and both of their pore sizes are 4.0 × 4.8 Å2. H atom and the coordinated DMF molecule are omitted for clarity.

elements.content: To investigate the permanent porosity of NJU-Bai33, the N2 adsorption isotherm was measured at 77 K. As shown in Figure S8, the N2 uptake amount is 302.5 cm3 g–1 (STP) at 1 bar. The N2 gas adsorption shows a reversible type I isotherm without hysteresis on desorption, which is characteristic of microporous material. The Brunauer–Emmett–Teller (BET) and Langmuir surface area of desolvated NJU-Bai33 were estimated to be 884.8 and 1072.5 m2 g–1, respectively. Furthermore, its Horvath–Kawazoe (H–K) pore diameter is 4.66 Å, which is almost consistent with the pore size as determined by the crystal structure. The pore volume given by the Dubinin–Radushkevich (DR) equation is 0.35 cm3 g–1, close to the theoretical value of 0.30 cm3 g–1 calculated using PLATON.
elements.clean_text: To investigate the permanent porosity of NJU-Bai33, the N2 adsorption isotherm was measured at 77 K. As shown in Figure S8, the N2 uptake amount is 302.5 cm3 g-1 (STP) at 1 bar. The N2 gas adsorption shows a reversible type I isotherm without hysteresis on desorption, which is characteristic of microporous material. The Brunauer-Emmett-Teller (BET) and Langmuir surface area of desolvated NJU-Bai33 were estimated to be 884.8 and 1072.5 m2 g-1, respectively. Furthermore, its Horvath-Kawazoe (H-K) pore diameter is 4.66 Å, which is almost consistent with the pore size as determined by the crystal structure. The pore volume given by the Dubinin-Radushkevich (DR) equation is 0.35 cm3 g-1, close to the theoretical value of 0.30 cm3 g-1 calculated using PLATON.

elements.content: Furthermore, its selective adsorption properties of CO2 versus N2 and CH4 were investigated. The CO2, N2, and CH4 adsorption measurements for NJU-Bai33 were carried out at 273 and 298 K (). At 0.15 bar, the uptake amounts of CO2 are 40.3 and 21.6 cm3 g–1, corresponding to 7.9 and 4.2 wt % at 273 and 298 K, respectively, which are lower than the uptake amounts for CO2 of NJU-Bai7, 11.8, and 8.0 wt % at 0.15 bar and under 273 and 298 K, respectively, but are substantially higher than those of the well-known MOFs, such as ZIF-78 (6.4 and 3.4 wt % at 0.15 bar and under 273 and 298 K, respectively), NH2-MIL-53­(Al) (3.2 wt %, at 298 K and 0.1 bar), en-Cu-BTTri (2.4 wt %, at 298 K and 0.15 bar), Cu-EBTC (5.9 wt %, at 273 K and 0.15 bar), SNU-4 (4.9 wt %, at 273 K and 0.15 bar), and MOF-5 (2.1 and 0.75 wt % at 0.15 bar and under 273 and 298 K, respectively). In addition, at 1 bar, the uptake amounts of CO2 are 86.2 and 65.6 cm3 g–1, corresponding to 16.9 and 12.9 wt % at 273 and 298 K, respectively, which are also comparable to the values of NJU-Bai7 (13.9 and 12.8 wt % at 1 bar and under 273 and 298 K, respectively). However, it is worthy of note that at 0.75 bar, NJU-Bai33 can only adsorb limited amounts of N2, 8.3 and 4.2 cm3 g–1, corresponding to 1.0 and 0.5 wt % at 273 and 298 K, respectively, and at 1 bar, the CH4 uptake amounts are also only 32.9 and 19.4 cm3 g–1, corresponding to 2.4 and 1.4 wt % at 273 and 298 K, respectively.
elements.clean_text: Furthermore, its selective adsorption properties of CO2 versus N2 and CH4 were investigated. The CO2, N2, and CH4 adsorption measurements for NJU-Bai33 were carried out at 273 and 298 K (). At 0.15 bar, the uptake amounts of CO2 are 40.3 and 21.6 cm3 g-1, corresponding to 7.9 and 4.2 wt % at 273 and 298 K, respectively, which are lower than the uptake amounts for CO2 of NJU-Bai7, 11.8, and 8.0 wt % at 0.15 bar and under 273 and 298 K, respectively, but are substantially higher than those of the well-known MOFs, such as ZIF-78 (6.4 and 3.4 wt % at 0.15 bar and under 273 and 298 K, respectively), NH2-MIL-53(Al) (3.2 wt %, at 298 K and 0.1 bar), en-Cu-BTTri (2.4 wt %, at 298 K and 0.15 bar), Cu-EBTC (5.9 wt %, at 273 K and 0.15 bar), SNU-4 (4.9 wt %, at 273 K and 0.15 bar), and MOF-5 (2.1 and 0.75 wt % at 0.15 bar and under 273 and 298 K, respectively). In addition, at 1 bar, the uptake amounts of CO2 are 86.2 and 65.6 cm3 g-1, corresponding to 16.9 and 12.9 wt % at 273 and 298 K, respectively, which are also comparable to the values of NJU-Bai7 (13.9 and 12.8 wt % at 1 bar and under 273 and 298 K, respectively). However, it is worthy of note that at 0.75 bar, NJU-Bai33 can only adsorb limited amounts of N2, 8.3 and 4.2 cm3 g-1, corresponding to 1.0 and 0.5 wt % at 273 and 298 K, respectively, and at 1 bar, the CH4 uptake amounts are also only 32.9 and 19.4 cm3 g-1, corresponding to 2.4 and 1.4 wt % at 273 and 298 K, respectively.

elements.content: CO2, N2, and CH4 adsorption isotherms of NJU-Bai33 at 273 (a) and 298 K (b) (filled symbols, adsorption; open symbols, desorption).
elements.clean_text: 3  CO2, N2, and CH4 adsorption isotherms of NJU-Bai33 at 273 (a) and 298 K (b) (filled symbols, adsorption; open symbols, desorption).

elements.content: The selectivity for CO2/N2 and CO2/CH4 of NJU-Bai33 at different temperatures was calculated by two different kinds of methods to evaluate its selective CO2 adsorption. As shown in , the selectivity predicted by ideal adsorbed solution theory (IAST) from the experimental single-component isotherms based on CO2/N2 (0.15:0.85) and CO2/CH4 (1:1) mixture is 58.7 and 9.7 at 273 K and 1 bar, respectively, and 40.3 and 8.9 at 298 K and 1 bar, correspondingly (). However, the values for NJU-Bai33 are still lower than those of NJFU-2 at 273 and 298 K, and the selectivity for CO2 over N2 of NJU-Bai33 is also less than that of NJU-Bai32 at 298 K (Table S4). In addition, the separation ratios of CO2 versus N2 and CH4 for NJU-Bai33 were also calculated from the ratio of the initial slopes based on the isotherms (Figures S16 and 17). The selectivity for CO2/N2 is 36.5 and 30.2 at 273 and 298 K, respectively, which is lower than 50.1 of ZIF-78 at 298 K, but still higher than 25.5 and 19.0 of SYSU at 273 and 298 K (Table S4). Moreover, the selectivity for CO2/CH4 is 7.8 and 6.8 at 273 and 298 K, respectively, which approaches the values of NJU-Bai7 (Table S4). The moderate selectivity for CO2 of NJU-Bai33 might mainly result from the open metal site exposed in the pore channels of the framework.
elements.clean_text: The selectivity for CO2/N2 and CO2/CH4 of NJU-Bai33 at different temperatures was calculated by two different kinds of methods to evaluate its selective CO2 adsorption. As shown in , the selectivity predicted by ideal adsorbed solution theory (IAST) from the experimental single-component isotherms based on CO2/N2 (0.15:0.85) and CO2/CH4 (1:1) mixture is 58.7 and 9.7 at 273 K and 1 bar, respectively, and 40.3 and 8.9 at 298 K and 1 bar, correspondingly (). However, the values for NJU-Bai33 are still lower than those of NJFU-2 at 273 and 298 K, and the selectivity for CO2 over N2 of NJU-Bai33 is also less than that of NJU-Bai32 at 298 K (Table S4). In addition, the separation ratios of CO2 versus N2 and CH4 for NJU-Bai33 were also calculated from the ratio of the initial slopes based on the isotherms (Figures S16 and 17). The selectivity for CO2/N2 is 36.5 and 30.2 at 273 and 298 K, respectively, which is lower than 50.1 of ZIF-78 at 298 K, but still higher than 25.5 and 19.0 of SYSU at 273 and 298 K (Table S4). Moreover, the selectivity for CO2/CH4 is 7.8 and 6.8 at 273 and 298 K, respectively, which approaches the values of NJU-Bai7 (Table S4). The moderate selectivity for CO2 of NJU-Bai33 might mainly result from the open metal site exposed in the pore channels of the framework.

elements.content: IAST predicted selectivity for CO2/N2 (0.15:0.85) and CO2/CH4 (1:1) mixture of NJU-Bai33 at 273 and 298 K.
elements.clean_text: 4  IAST predicted selectivity for CO2/N2 (0.15:0.85) and CO2/CH4 (1:1) mixture of NJU-Bai33 at 273 and 298 K.

elements.content: To evaluate the adsorbent–adsorbate interaction, the adsorption enthalpy for CO2 of NJU-Bai33 at zero-loading calculated by the virial method using the experimental isotherm data at 273 and 298 K is 25.7 kJ mol–1 (Figure S13), which is in the usual range of the porous MOFs. The isosteric heats (Q st) for CH4 adsorption of NJU-Bai33 is also estimated to be 20.8 kJ mol–1, which is close to the corresponding values found for most promising MOFs for methane storage.
elements.clean_text: To evaluate the adsorbent-adsorbate interaction, the adsorption enthalpy for CO2 of NJU-Bai33 at zero-loading calculated by the virial method using the experimental isotherm data at 273 and 298 K is 25.7 kJ mol-1 (Figure S13), which is in the usual range of the porous MOFs. The isosteric heats (Q st) for CH4 adsorption of NJU-Bai33 is also estimated to be 20.8 kJ mol-1, which is close to the corresponding values found for most promising MOFs for methane storage.

elements.content: In summary, on the basis of the organic ligand of 5-(pyridin-3-yl)­isophthalic acid (H2L), a new distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster based MOF with (3,3,6) topology, NJU-Bai33, has been synthesized. Very interestingly, it exhibits a new point (Schläfli) symbol of (4·62)2(42·68·85) and further enriches the library of (3,6)-connected MOFs. Moreover, it shows selective adsorption of CO2 over N2 and CH4 with the CO2 uptake amounts high up to 7.9 and 4.2 wt % at 0.15 bar and at 273 and 298 K, respectively, and may be an excellently potential candidate for CO2 capture, such as the postcombustion CO2 capture and the purification of natural gases.
elements.clean_text: In summary, on the basis of the organic ligand of 5-(pyridin-3-yl)isophthalic acid (H2L), a new distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster based MOF with (3,3,6) topology, NJU-Bai33, has been synthesized. Very interestingly, it exhibits a new point (Schläfli) symbol of (4⋅62)2(42⋅68⋅85) and further enriches the library of (3,6)-connected MOFs. Moreover, it shows selective adsorption of CO2 over N2 and CH4 with the CO2 uptake amounts high up to 7.9 and 4.2 wt % at 0.15 bar and at 273 and 298 K, respectively, and may be an excellently potential candidate for CO2 capture, such as the postcombustion CO2 capture and the purification of natural gases.

Crystal data for NJU-Bai33, [Mn2(L)2DMF]⋅xG: C29H21Mn2N3O9 (guest molecules removed with PLATON SQUEEZE30), M r = 665.37, monoclinic, Cc, a = 14.107(3) Å, b = 15.163(3) Å, c = 17.765(3) Å, α = γ = 90, β = 111.025(3) Å, V = 3547.0(12) Å3, Z = 4, F  000  = 1352, T = 150(2) K, 12232 reflections collected, 8824 independent reflections (R int = 0.0874) R 1 = 0.0906, wR 2 = 0.2161 for [I > 2σ(I)] and GOF = 1.097.

cln_elements.content:
On the basis of the ligand of 5-(pyridin-3-yl)­isophthalic acid (H2L), a new distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster based metal–organic framework with (3,3,6) topology, [Mn2(L)2DMF]­·DMF·MeOH (NJU-Bai33; DMF = N,N- dimethylformamide), was synthesized, which exhibits a new point (Schläfli) symbol of (4·62)2(42·68·85), contains open metal sites, and shows selective adsorption of CO2 over N2 and CH4 with CO2 uptake amounts high up to 7.9 and 4.2 wt % at 0.15 bar and at 273 and 298 K, respectively.

A new distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster based metal−organic framework with (3,3,6) topology was synthesized, which exhibits a new point (Schläfli) symbol of (4·62)2­(42·68·85), contains open metal sites after removal of the ligated solvent, and shows selective adsorption of CO2 over N2 and CH4 with CO2 uptake amounts high up to 7.9 and 4.2 wt % at 0.15 bar and at 273 and 298 K, respectively.

To investigate the permanent porosity of NJU-Bai33, the N2 adsorption isotherm was measured at 77 K. As shown in Figure S8, the N2 uptake amount is 302.5 cm3 g–1 (STP) at 1 bar. The N2 gas adsorption shows a reversible type I isotherm without hysteresis on desorption, which is characteristic of microporous material. The Brunauer–Emmett–Teller (BET) and Langmuir surface area of desolvated NJU-Bai33 were estimated to be 884.8 and 1072.5 m2 g–1, respectively. Furthermore, its Horvath–Kawazoe (H–K) pore diameter is 4.66 Å, which is almost consistent with the pore size as determined by the crystal structure. The pore volume given by the Dubinin–Radushkevich (DR) equation is 0.35 cm3 g–1, close to the theoretical value of 0.30 cm3 g–1 calculated using PLATON.

Furthermore, its selective adsorption properties of CO2 versus N2 and CH4 were investigated. The CO2, N2, and CH4 adsorption measurements for NJU-Bai33 were carried out at 273 and 298 K (). At 0.15 bar, the uptake amounts of CO2 are 40.3 and 21.6 cm3 g–1, corresponding to 7.9 and 4.2 wt % at 273 and 298 K, respectively, which are lower than the uptake amounts for CO2 of NJU-Bai7, 11.8, and 8.0 wt % at 0.15 bar and under 273 and 298 K, respectively, but are substantially higher than those of the well-known MOFs, such as ZIF-78 (6.4 and 3.4 wt % at 0.15 bar and under 273 and 298 K, respectively), NH2-MIL-53­(Al) (3.2 wt %, at 298 K and 0.1 bar), en-Cu-BTTri (2.4 wt %, at 298 K and 0.15 bar), Cu-EBTC (5.9 wt %, at 273 K and 0.15 bar), SNU-4 (4.9 wt %, at 273 K and 0.15 bar), and MOF-5 (2.1 and 0.75 wt % at 0.15 bar and under 273 and 298 K, respectively). In addition, at 1 bar, the uptake amounts of CO2 are 86.2 and 65.6 cm3 g–1, corresponding to 16.9 and 12.9 wt % at 273 and 298 K, respectively, which are also comparable to the values of NJU-Bai7 (13.9 and 12.8 wt % at 1 bar and under 273 and 298 K, respectively). However, it is worthy of note that at 0.75 bar, NJU-Bai33 can only adsorb limited amounts of N2, 8.3 and 4.2 cm3 g–1, corresponding to 1.0 and 0.5 wt % at 273 and 298 K, respectively, and at 1 bar, the CH4 uptake amounts are also only 32.9 and 19.4 cm3 g–1, corresponding to 2.4 and 1.4 wt % at 273 and 298 K, respectively.

In summary, on the basis of the organic ligand of 5-(pyridin-3-yl)­isophthalic acid (H2L), a new distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster based MOF with (3,3,6) topology, NJU-Bai33, has been synthesized. Very interestingly, it exhibits a new point (Schläfli) symbol of (4·62)2(42·68·85) and further enriches the library of (3,6)-connected MOFs. Moreover, it shows selective adsorption of CO2 over N2 and CH4 with the CO2 uptake amounts high up to 7.9 and 4.2 wt % at 0.15 bar and at 273 and 298 K, respectively, and may be an excellently potential candidate for CO2 capture, such as the postcombustion CO2 capture and the purification of natural gases.

The authors declare no competing financial interest.

Crystal data for NJU-Bai33, [Mn2(L)2DMF]·xG: C29H21Mn2N3O9 (guest molecules removed with PLATON SQUEEZE30), M r = 665.37, monoclinic, Cc, a = 14.107(3) Å, b = 15.163(3) Å, c = 17.765(3) Å, α = γ = 90, β = 111.025(3) Å, V = 3547.0(12) Å3, Z = 4, F 000 = 1352, T = 150(2) K, 12 232 reflections collected, 8824 independent reflections (R int = 0.0874) R 1 = 0.0906, wR 2 = 0.2161 for [I > 2σ(I)] and GOF = 1.097.

A new distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster based metal-organic framework with (3,3,6) topology was synthesized, which exhibits a new point (Schläfli) symbol of (4⋅62)2(42⋅68⋅85), contains open metal sites after removal of the ligated solvent, and shows selective adsorption of CO2 over N2 and CH4 with CO2 uptake amounts high up to 7.9 and 4.2 wt % at 0.15 bar and at 273 and 298 K, respectively.

Very interestingly, it exhibits a new point (Schläfli) symbol of (4⋅62)2(42⋅68⋅85) and further enriches the library of (3,6)-connected MOFs. Moreover, it shows selective adsorption of CO2 over N2 and CH4 with the CO2 uptake amounts high up to 7.9 and 4.2 wt % at 0.15 bar and at 273 and 298 K, respectively, and may be an excellently potential candidate for CO2 capture, such as the postcombustion CO2 capture and the purification of natural gases.

The authors declare no competing financial interest.

Crystal data for NJU-Bai33, [Mn2(L)2DMF]⋅xG: C29H21Mn2N3O9 (guest molecules removed with PLATON SQUEEZE30), M r = 665.37, monoclinic, Cc, a = 14.107(3) Å, b = 15.163(3) Å, c = 17.765(3) Å, α = γ = 90, β = 111.025(3) Å, V = 3547.0(12) Å3, Z = 4, F  000  = 1352, T = 150(2) K, 12232 reflections collected, 8824 independent reflections (R int = 0.0874) R 1 = 0.0906, wR 2 = 0.2161 for [I > 2σ(I)] and GOF = 1.097.

cln_elements.content: (a) The ball and stick model of the distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster with coordinated DMF molecule. The gray, red, rose, and blue spheres represent carbon, oxygen, manganese, and nitrogen atoms, respectively. (b) The coordination environment of the distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster; (c) the coordination modes of the organic ligand, H2L.
cln_elements.clean_text: 1  (a) The ball and stick model of the distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster with coordinated DMF molecule. The gray, red, rose, and blue spheres represent carbon, oxygen, manganese, and nitrogen atoms, respectively. (b) The coordination environment of the distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] cluster; (c) the coordination modes of the organic ligand, H2L.

cln_elements.content: (a) The metal cluster is linked by the ligand with L2 mode leading to the formation of a 2D hcb topological layer, which is further pillared by the ligand with L1 mode giving the formation of 3D NJU-Bai33 (top and middle); (middle) in NJU-Bai33, the 2D hcb topological layer adopts the packing way of AB stacking model; (bottom) the topological network of NJU-Bai33 with the point symbol of (4·62)2(42·68·85), in which organic ligands with two different coordination modes of L1 (lime) and L2 (gold) can be simplified as two different kinds of 3-connected nodes; (b) in NJU-Bai33, two similar 1D channels along the directions of (a+b) and (a-b) are formed, respectively, and both of their pore sizes are 4.0 × 4.8 Å2. H atom and the coordinated DMF molecule are omitted for clarity.
cln_elements.clean_text: 2  (a) The metal cluster is linked by the ligand with L2 mode leading to the formation of a 2D hcb topological layer, which is further pillared by the ligand with L1 mode giving the formation of 3D NJU-Bai33 (top and middle); (middle) in NJU-Bai33, the 2D hcb topological layer adopts the packing way of AB stacking model; (bottom) the topological network of NJU-Bai33 with the point symbol of (4⋅62)2(42⋅68⋅85), in which organic ligands with two different coordination modes of L1 (lime) and L2 (gold) can be simplified as two different kinds of 3-connected nodes; (b) in NJU-Bai33, two similar 1D channels along the directions of (a+b) and (a-b) are formed, respectively, and both of their pore sizes are 4.0 × 4.8 Å2. H atom and the coordinated DMF molecule are omitted for clarity.

cln_elements.content: CO2, N2, and CH4 adsorption isotherms of NJU-Bai33 at 273 (a) and 298 K (b) (filled symbols, adsorption; open symbols, desorption).
cln_elements.clean_text: 3  CO2, N2, and CH4 adsorption isotherms of NJU-Bai33 at 273 (a) and 298 K (b) (filled symbols, adsorption; open symbols, desorption).

cln_elements.content: IAST predicted selectivity for CO2/N2 (0.15:0.85) and CO2/CH4 (1:1) mixture of NJU-Bai33 at 273 and 298 K.
cln_elements.clean_text: 4  IAST predicted selectivity for CO2/N2 (0.15:0.85) and CO2/CH4 (1:1) mixture of NJU-Bai33 at 273 and 298 K.

metadata.title:
A Distorted [Mn2(COO)4N2] Cluster Based Metal–Organic Framework with (3,3,6)
Topology and Selective Adsorption of CO2
